name: Google Support and Resistance Trading Backtest
question: How profitable would trading GOOGL based on key support and resistance levels have been?
retailQuestion: Does buying Google when it hits support levels and selling at resistance work?
description: Backtests a support and resistance trading strategy on Google (GOOGL) using historical price levels and volume confirmation. Identifies key psychological levels and tests buying at support with stops below, and selling at resistance targets over 6 years of trading data.

workflow.description: Step 1: Get 6+ years of GOOGL daily OHLC and volume data
Step 2: Get current GOOGL market data for latest level analysis
Step 3: Identify key support and resistance levels using price action
Step 4: Backtest level-based trading with volume confirmation and stops
Step 5: Analyze success rates, risk-reward ratios, and level reliability

followUp: Are support and resistance levels reliable for trading?
How do I identify the right levels to trade?
Should I use stop losses when trading levels?
Is this strategy better than buy-and-hold for Google?
